comments.body: This is complicated. Any reason not to have the methods directly on the class, and implement `DatasetCore` here?

The reason is maintenance and DRYness.

If you repeat all the methods, any time `DatasetCore` changes any implementing class has to be updated. And it can happen that Typescript will not signal that, causing inconsistency.

This way only the actually overridden or additional members are declared

> If you repeat all the methods, any time `DatasetCore` changes any implementing class has to be updated.

Guess this refers to the lack of semver on `@types/*`? Agree that is a problem...
Not necessarily. In the end this is just useless repetition...
This (and others) probably take a `DatasetCore<InQuad ,Q>` rather than just a `DatasetIndexed`?

Unfortunately not. Underneath the `N3Store` calls `_addQuads` which either iterates an array or calls `toArray`, the latter not being member of `DatasetCore`

https://github.com/rdf-ext/rdf-dataset-indexed/blob/7ea6c12626be211080c25af6c6eb853318474fbc/lib/N3Store.js#L300-L304
